intro: Stravadium acutangulum, commonly known as the sharp-angled stravadium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves with a distinctive acute angle. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in late summer. Stravadium acutangulum is adapted to high-altitude environments, exhibiting features that help it survive in cold and arid conditions.
